resources.string: Coffee seeds are generally planted in large beds in shaded nurseries. Planting often takes place during the wet season, so that the soil remains moist.
It will take approximately 3 to 4 years for the newly planted coffee trees to bear fruit. The coffee cherry, turns a bright, deep red when it is ripe and ready to be harvested.
Once the coffee has been picked, processing must begin as quickly as possible to prevent fruit spoilage.
